TITLE: 'Incredible alpha opportunities' in the year ahead despite headwinds, says Carlyle Group CEO Harvey Schwartz
SUMMARY: Wall Street leaders speaking at the annual Riyadh event broadly expressed varying degrees of pessimism and caution for the coming year.

TITLE: 'The bond vigilante is coming back,' UBS strategist says
SUMMARY: The "bond vigilantes are coming back" as investors continue to sell amid the prospect of a growing fiscal deficit, according to UBS Asset Management's Kevin Zhao.

TITLE: Wall Street hikes forecasts for anti-obesity drug sales to $100 billion and beyond. A look at the numbers
SUMMARY: Citi notched its estimate for incretin drug sales to $71 billion by 2035, up from its prior estimate of $55 billion. That view seems conservative. Here's why.

TITLE: Starboard may be poised to build value amicably at contract research firm Fortrea
SUMMARY: Activist Starboard Value recently disclosed a position in Fortrea Holdings. The firm may be able to take a friendly approach to building shareholder value.

TITLE: Regional bank shares slump as lenders warn of more pain from higher interest rates
SUMMARY: Several weak quarterly earnings reports highlighting the negative effect of higher interest rates soured investor sentiment on the industry.
